name: Upwork
sdescription:
Fixed or hourly projects. Largest client listing. Lots of low-paid competition. Horrible Support. Guaranteed payment for hourly 20%/10%/5% depending on engagement length.
Why do people hate Upwork?

name: Freelancer
sdescription: Much like upwork but their pricing is more around paying per listing/application.

name: PeoplePerHour
sdescription: Emphasis on shorter projects. Spec work also.

name: Toptal
sdescription: Can be hard to actually get jobs. Big name clients. Hourly or weekly engagements. Recruiters sell you to clients. Some sense of "community".

name: Guru.com
sdescription: Larger profile section for freelancers. Payment on completion with "resolution process" if client is unhappy.

name: CodeMentor X
sdescription: Get paid for short tutoring sessions or find clients. Bit of a vetting process. For client projects payments aren't guaranteed.

name: Speedlancer
sdescription: Smaller tasks. Design, writing, or short term tech engadgements.
